snippet: Officials said they were slowing the operation to call for reinforcements and to preserve property and civilian lives.
abstract: Iraqi Army and allied militias pause offensive on Tikrit, Iraq, with Islamic State militants still controlling parts of city; say break is to avoid civilian casualties and await reinforcements; tomb of former Pres Saddam Hussein, politically charged symbol for both sides, is reportedly destroyed.

byline.contributor: Ahmad Salah contributed reporting from Baghdad, and an employee of The New York Times from Kirkuk, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Officials said they were slowing the operation to call for reinforcements and to preserve property and civilian lives.

headline.main: ISIS Keeps Hold in Tikrit as Iraq Pauses Offensive
headline.print_headline: ISIS Keeps Hold in Tikrit as Iraq Pauses Offensive

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
